self explanatory.

With 3.3 beta 1, Tomcat's directory index page's "Go up to:" link at the top 
does not function with IE5. It does not postpend a trailing backslash, so 
Tomcat (as I "defualt" installed it) doesn't know where the directory is, and 
neither would Apache, for that matter, since the new mod_jk.conf"-auto" file 
(auto/mod_jk.conf) does not generate the aliases as before, so Apache would 
need the trailing backslash as well.

I'm not sure I understand the problems. Can you give an example - AFAIK the 
static handler ( which does dirs ) didin't changed - how is the link and how 
is it supposed to be ? Also, what's wrong with the generated conf file ? 
Are you using "all to tomcat" or "static to apache" mode ? 

Thanks,
Costin
